This is a huge victory for the Problem Solvers Caucus and for First Responders across the US. It was a moral imperative to get this done, and I hope the President’s signature provides hope and peace of mind to 9/11 First Responders and their families. https://www.theintell.com/news/20190729/fitzpatrick-joins-trump-as-president-signs-911-victims-fund-extension …

I am grateful to have been included in this event with President Trump and Vice President Pence, and to see the hard work of all our 9/11 First Responder advocates come to fruition. pic.twitter.com/Q51aDhdvYg

As a former FBI Special Agent in New York City, it was humbling to be invited by the President to attend the signing of the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund renewal with our hero First Responders. I would like to thank @RepPeteKing , @RepMaloney and Jon Stewart for their advocacy.

The loss of life at the Gilroy Garlic Festival, including that of 6 year-old Steven Romero, is completely heartbreaking.  May our nation provide love and comfort to these victims, and a fervent resolve to end these senseless acts of gun violence through all means necessary.
Happy Birthday, @RepPerryWarren! Looking forward to continuing to work with you to get results for the people of Bucks County. pic.twitter.com/6AMr30w0TT

The closure of the PES Refinery has ramifications for my constituents. On this 29th anniversary of the passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act, I was proud to introduce the Disability Employment Incentive Act with @RepJoshHarder. Congress just passed the Stopping Bad Robocalls Act! For too long, residents of Bucks and Montgomery counties have been harassed by robocalls that are both annoying and dangerous. This bill would impose stronger penalties on scammers who seek to steal sensitive information. pic.twitter.com/0TaBGYGdUo
